posts.post_content:
Better than [Reassembling Skeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reassembling Skeleton) when you have [Aluren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aluren). Just choose your sac outlet.   
Infinite damage: [Goblin Bombardment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bombardment)  
Infinite life: [Life Chisel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life Chisel) (since you can play at instant speed)  
Infinite mill: [Altar of Dementia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Altar of Dementia)  
Infinite mana: [Ashnod's Altar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashnod's Altar)  
And so on.  
  
\*Acknowledges that there is no "infinite" in magic.\*

Posted By: wholelottalove (1/29/2013 9:56:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Would have loved to see that one with flash.  
Or to be unblockable. Which would have worked great with the Cypher mechanic.  
And to some extent, it would also have been a nice shoutout to [Dimir Infiltrator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dimir Infiltrator).  
  
However, the ability fits perfectly to a blue/black card.  
  
As it is, it's not exactly that powerful that it would have needed the dual-colored casting cost.  
They could have made it a hybrid card as well.  
Or they could have given it a stronger body, like 2/1.  
Or add a may-clause, just in case.  
  
I'd say it's certainly missing something.   
Well, at least regarding playability - regarding flavor, this one is damn slick!
posts.html:
Would have loved to see that one with flash.
Or to be unblockable. Which would have worked great with the Cypher mechanic.
And to some extent, it would also have been a nice shoutout to Dimir Infiltrator.

However, the ability fits perfectly to a blue/black card.

As it is, it's not exactly that powerful that it would have needed the dual-colored casting cost.
They could have made it a hybrid card as well.
Or they could have given it a stronger body, like 2/1.
Or add a may-clause, just in case.

I'd say it's certainly missing something.
Well, at least regarding playability - regarding flavor, this one is damn slick!

Posted By: Mode (1/28/2013 12:42:55 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Forms a loop of Creature ETB triggers with [Deathrender](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathrender) and any sac outlet. Equip the Deathrender to the Strider, sac it, put the Deathrender trigger on the stack, put the Strider trigger on the stack, Strider trigger resolves putting it in your hand, Deathrender trigger resolves and you can put the Strider into play with Deathrender equipped. Add Warstorm Surge and that's game.
posts.html:
Forms a loop of Creature ETB triggers with Deathrender and any sac outlet. Equip the Deathrender to the Strider, sac it, put the Deathrender trigger on the stack, put the Strider trigger on the stack, Strider trigger resolves putting it in your hand, Deathrender trigger resolves and you can put the Strider into play with Deathrender equipped. Add Warstorm Surge and that's game.

posts.post_content:
Coolest common in the set BY FAR. Not because it's super-powered or even necessarily good. No.  
  
It's just BADASS. A B/U skeleton? An awesome name? Sweet art? An ability that doesn't give two craps about what the majority of removal thinks? This guy should have sunglasses over those empty eye sockets!  
  
Also, [Corpse Blockade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpse Blockade) is a nice little defensive combo. You can get immense card value out of that over the course of a game.
posts.html:
Coolest common in the set BY FAR. Not because it's super-powered or even necessarily good. No.

It's just BADASS. A B/U skeleton? An awesome name? Sweet art? An ability that doesn't give two craps about what the majority of removal thinks? This guy should have sunglasses over those empty eye sockets!

Also, Corpse Blockade is a nice little defensive combo. You can get immense card value out of that over the course of a game.
